And even to some who have deserved that, he will remit all, or at least, capital punishment, either out of humanity, or for some other plausible causes. So Diodorus says that victory depends on fortune, but anerey in victory on virtue. So Curtius, of Alexander.

VIII. With regard to those who are killed without its being in- tended, we must hold that if justice do not require, at least mercy does, that we should not, except for weighty causes tending to the safety of many, undertake anything which may involve innocent per- sons in destruction. So Polybius.
